result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary L Melvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary L Melvin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary L Melvin was found guilty of County Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
BLOTTER PLEA

Def entered a plea of No Contest to Count 3 as amended.

AMENDMENTS: 32.03/947.01(1)

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count 2 and Use of Dangerous Weapon on Count 3.

COURT COSTS:
Ct #3
-$30 fine + court costs
-All cc, due w/in 60 days. Payment plan aprroved.

Abby H.
Pre-trial conference on July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SM. 
- Defendant shall not be at Menards. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

11:47 AM Defendant appeared.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
